normalized: the space era had been brilliant.
two major technologies, the terra-forming plant and the plasma-engine, had been developed at the dawn of this era.
following the first terra-forming project of mars in the year 2123 a.
d.
, numerous other planets and satellites had become terrestrial, and various space colonies had been established.
humanity spread throughout the solar system in the blink of an eye, with the super powerful plasma-engine at the core of its advance.
however, even though technology had advanced and the places where life thrived had changed, it had made little difference to the nature of humanity.
it became common practice for the people in space, who were the elite of this new era, to drive the impoverished people to earth.
the earth state took control of these colonies and gradually became stronger.
martian city-states, star-colony systems and other space colonies, which rebelled against this faction, established the federation of the space alliance which was based on jupiter’satellite, titan.
they jointly established the first space army of the human race and succeeded in acquiring a powerful voice within the space society.
each star-colony broke ties with the earth state, one after another, under the pretext of a peaceful solution, and became independent.

the isolation of the nations on earth deepened, and the four super-powers therein became concerned about the transfer of the political centre of the space era and the potential birth of a huge nation, which could rule the entire solar system.

these four super-powers ― the european-russian federation, the american-pacific federation, the great asian commonwealth and the large people’s republic of china ― proclaimed a great alliance of the earth state after many years of conflict.
any nations which opposed the infringement of the four super-powers, who were named the alliance, upon their sovereignty were attacked with thermo-nuclear weapons by these four powers.
it was known as the august war of blood, the worst massacre in human history.
all opposing powers were wiped off the face of the earth, and the national union of earth was established.
and soon, in the year 2210 a.
d.

it was approved via an electronic vote that the satellite, titan, would be the head of the association conducting the negotiations between the federation of the space alliance and the national union of earth.
the universal federal government was established in a way that the federation of the space alliance and the national union of earth would be allied to become the first unified regime of humanity.
it was the beginning of space history.
however, the promise of peace that the people expected in this new era had transformed to that of sheer disappointment, within ten years.
neo-terras made it their top priority for the return of humanity to earth and the protection of their earthly interests.
while the new-solars aimed to break away from the vested interests of the national union of earth.
the embers of this fiery universal conflict continued to smoulder.
the people in the universal federal government became divided into two factions, the military faction and the civilian faction, and instigated a fierce tug-of-war, which was akin to a civil war.
in these circumstances, the ex-commander of the space federal army, donny bohgan,

assumed the dukedom of the fortress nation of cordelia of uranus, which was also the standard bearer for the neutral forces, and established a third power, die erde, starting a new space calendar in the process.

bohgan, the founder and the first chairman of die erde, ended up embroiling new-solars’ and neo-terras’ star-colonies and space colonies into the rebellion, after they had risen up to revolt against the universal federal government.
neo-terras and new-solars, in this moment of crisis, ended up joining hands in a secret truce.
with the reputation of the universal federal government in tatters, they marched on cordelia, the stronghold of die erde, with an allied fleet comprised of both factions.
space era year 45, new space era year 1.
the war broke out in the tertiary atmosphere of cordelia.
everyone in the solar system was confident of victory for the allied fleet, however the result was unexpected.
donny bohgan drove the allied fleet to the brink of annihilation by directing the die erde armed forces himself.
it was an overwhelming victory.
the allied fleet suffered historic losses and it was estimated that it would take them ten years to just rebuild their forces.

following that war, the influence of neo-terras and new-solars rapidly deteriorated, and soon thereafter, the empress, beatrice kushan, began her rebellion under the pretext of development and started heavily rewriting the martian power-map.
now, the solar system was about to enter a new phase.
now――
earth year 2256 a.
d.
, space era year 46, new space era year 2…
on october 28.
within the martian sand sea.
a battleship was navigating the vast desert.
the name of this battleship was the tristan.
it was a high-speed battleship of the libra armed forces.
these battleships had been obsolete antiques until recently, before the drastic changes in the martian environment and in particular the occurrence of the sand sea.
the desert battleships used deuterium as fuel and plasma, generated by nuclear fusion within the engine-core, as an energy source in order to rotate the screws and generate driving force.
this seemingly primitive system of propulsion was designed to overcome the sand sea.
this desert’s sand which was of a special nature, with properties of water, was called minimal sand, and its compatibility with every other precision equipment was abysmal.
minimal sand would enter any gaps like water and clog the machinery like sand.
if mobile weapons weren’t designed with the sand sea specifications, they would soon clog up with the sand and become dysfunctional.
the superiority of these sand-based weapons would, undoubtedly, greatly affect the outcome of wars on mars.
it could be said that in these circumstances the wars on mars were akin to the first world war, when command on the seas had made a big impact on the outcome of the war.
the tristan, blowing up a spray of the minimal sand, was about to reach perseus city, the stronghold of the kushan armed forces.

name: adamo
normalized: gentlemen!
the great duty that you have been bestowed with finally enters the second stage!
i declared loudly.
my name was celio adamo.
i was the colonel of the libra armed forces, and the captain of the tristan.
right now, i was in the tristan’s operations room.
all my senior officers were gathered in front of me.
the faces of my men were glaring, like wild beasts on the verge of assaulting women.
seeing that look on their faces put me in a good spirit.
i addressed each and every one of my men to make my point clear.

name: adamo
normalized: since the beginning, we, of libra, have declared our eternal neutrality to this dispute, even as the fierce ground battle in the quagmire has continued unabated.

name: adamo
normalized: the martian capital, with its talented personnel, is now an economic powerhouse that no power can ignore any longer.

name: adamo
normalized: and now, to ensure that libra can fulfil its heavy responsibility to the interspace community satisfactorily,

name: adamo
normalized: we have our best personnel to bridge the peace talks on mars between the all-conquering kushan armed forces and the forces of the neo-terras!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

normalized: at last, we, the messengers of peace, will invite “the empress” and her daughter, “the grim reaper of the sands”, on-board the tristan!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

name: adamo
normalized: let us all welcome them appropriately!
the officers whistled at my words and stood upright and ready.
everyone was thinking about the same thing.
to rape the pig-sluts who didn’t know their place, and dominate, and abuse and ravage them thoroughly.
as always.
no.
in the most severe way possible, taking into account all our past grudges against them.

name: adamo
normalized: gentlemen!
it seems to me that the empress has been caught!
in the trap of celio adamo?
no,

name: bohgan
normalized: in the trap of donny bohgan!
i thrust my right fist up.

name: my men
normalized: captain!
we have been looking forward to this!
revenge on the pig-sluts!
their raucous cheers rose to a cacophony and shook the tristan.

name: bohgan
normalized: kukuku
yes, it was me.
it was donny bohgan.
i was the highest authority in die erde, however, now i was going by the name of celio adamo, a soldier of one of the city-states of mars.
of course, it was all a ploy for the sake of crushing those women.

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen!
i commanded my excited men.

name: bohgan
normalized: the fact that mahoi died was something i had considered to be a possibility!

name: bohgan
normalized: being a combat operative, he was bound to “do something” in the den of the tigress!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!
it was only the other day, that mahoi’s severed head had been delivered to moller’s residence.
my only expectation had been for him to do his duty like a quiet dog, but he was a foolish man.
no, those pig-sluts would have killed him regardless.
because, they didn’t like dogs.

name: bohgan
normalized: after the war situation escalates in our favour, i believe the old leadership of the neo-terras, who have desired to gain a foothold on mars for years, will cooperate with us, even if beatrice and kila kushan end up dead.

name: bohgan
normalized: beatrice and kila have already been made to believe that the fake peace negotiations are genuine.

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

name: bohgan
normalized: because, our word has already spread among the neo-terras!

name: bohgan
normalized: beatrice has surely obtained reports from her spies in the neo-terras by now, as she seems to have been investigating us carefully, and she will be of the belief that we are genuine!

name: bohgan
normalized: no one, including those old men who have been playing their big game behind our backs while using our cooperation, knows the truth about us!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

name: bohgan
normalized: of course, we have no intention of fulfilling the hopes of those old men!

name: bohgan
normalized: i am not going to kill beatrice and kila!

name: bohgan
normalized: we will make them our pawns and let them live their lives as pigs, or let them die of shame and humiliation as pigs!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen, be rest assured!

name: bohgan
normalized: i have spent several years investing in the governing body of the libra armed forces, who live by the peace-at-any-price attitude, and now we will put that investment to good use!

name: bohgan
normalized: in other words, all of us hold the responsibility of executing this strategy of mine!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!

name: bohgan
normalized: we are to creep in as the libra armed forces, a third party with goodwill, on those bloody women!
those bloody women have killed tens of thousands of our people on mars!

name: bohgan
normalized: calm down!

normalized: radio waves coming from the engine-core will disturb any sensors and make them impossible to track.
the man, who i had selected as my lieutenant recently, saluted with a calm gesture.
originally, the director of the 『brainwashing laboratory』, he had been evaluated and found to have a good balance of diversity of skills and intelligence, and was appointed as my lieutenant.
he was a good man and the self-styled 『widow eater』.

he had a slight figure but was a sharp individual who had established a reputation, especially with respect to the army’s operation skills, and was trusted by my staff officers for his judgement as well.
he was a person whose hobby was to collect books.

normalized: mars will be yours to command in approximately two weeks, just about the time when we transfer those two women to libra city, my lord.
the aging man was a specialist on brain operations, and manipulated memory functions.

major hans, captain ingeborg, lieutenant olov, and army-surgeon captain magnus.

name: bohgan
normalized: excellent, i look forward to your success.
hail for the glory of die erde!

name: my men
normalized: hail!
it sounded like the burning chorus of lust.
i retired to the captain’s quarters, after having given my subordinates the last of the instructions.
i poured red martian wine into my glass and raised my glass up to the martian sky, as a dust storm danced along it.

name: bohgan
normalized: cordelia is on the verge of withering away due to these bloody women rampaging violently all over mars, but… i am close now.

name: bohgan
normalized: as fate would have it, i have to overcome this problem again.

name: bohgan
normalized: my most terrible enemies, beatrice kushan and kila kushan… you will be made to wallow in my revenge, i swear it!
my right arm, with which i was holding the glass, creaked slightly.
it was giving off the jarring sound of a machine.
my right arm was a prosthetic arm.
phantom limb pain.
the spot where my arm had been severed by those women, was stinging in pain.
